Articles.Content:
I haven't looked through the whole thread, but here's one I saw many years ago by someone, and it forced me to make life changes!

" One day your life will pass before your eyes,    make sure it's worth watching"

Still hits me now, take care everybody...

You're gonna need a bigger boat.

Martin Brody

Edited October 24, 2021 by antipro

Hello, my name is Inigo Montoya. You killed my father. Prepare to die. - ENG
Hola. Me llamo Íñigo Montoya. Tú mataste a mi padre. Prepárate a morir. - SPA dubbing
Hola. Mi nombre es Inigo Montoya. Tu hai ucciso mi padre. Preparate a morir. - ITA dubbing

Inigo Montoya

Edited October 31, 2021 by antipro

"Well I would have thought that being bored stiff three quarters of the time was an excellent preparation for working life."

- Sir Humphrey Appleby (speaking about education.)

"Look at me! Soaring through the air as majestically as an eagle... piloting a blimp!"

- Scott Manley.

On 7/1/2021 at 9:14 AM, Fraston said:

“English: ‘Welcome to hell, population: buffalo’”

You haven't tried to learn Afrikaans! There's about ten trillion rules for everything, and Afrikaans is about (to quote Arnold Rimmer) "...as useful as a (I'm not sure this word is forum safe, due to its use in something which definitely is not safe) machine in the Vatican."

Yes, I am a smeghead. 

 

"Now, now! Keep your hair on...

Or you'll soon be heirless."

-Julius Ceasar.

Edited November 13, 2021 by Hyperspace Industries

On 11/11/2021 at 2:48 AM, mattinoz said:

*That said I am Architect and we can bulldoze all but the street facing wall and still call it an alteration.  

Sorry for so many posts, but I keep finding good quotes.

"Looks like Darth Vader's bathroom." Michael Knight.

"Give a man a duck and he'll eat for a week. Teach a man to duck and he'll avoid low flying objects." -a comedian.

Edited November 16, 2021 by Hyperspace Industries
Moar Quotes!

«L'enfer, c'est les autres.»

Jean-Paul Sartre

“Everything has its wonders, even silence and darkness” 

- Helen Keller

"This quote was taken out of context."

-Randall Munroe

"Nothing vast enters the life of mortals without a curse."

Sophocles



 

“There are only two industries that call their customers 'users': illegal drugs and software”

Edward Tufte

Edited December 3, 2021 by antipro

On 11/7/2021 at 2:53 PM, Hyperspace Industries said:

"Look at me! Soaring through the air as majestically as an eagle... piloting a blimp!"

- Scott Manley.

I believe this dates back to GlaDOS

War... War Never Changes   
                                      - Fallout (every game)

Edited December 3, 2021 by Just Jim

"The Enrichment Center promises to always provide a safe testing environment. In dangerous testing environments, the Enrichment Center promises to always provide useful advice. For instance: the floor here will kill you. Try to avoid it."

-GLADOS
"Since there's no ending quote mark, everything after this is part of my quote. -Randall Munroe

"Failure is ALWAYS an option - wait, am I missing an eyebrow?"

Adam Savage, Mythbusters

"I'm a politician, so that means I'm a cheat and a liar. When I'm not kissing babies, I'm stealing their lollipops."

-Someone from The Hunt For Red October.

"People say nothing is impossible, but I do nothing every day!"

-Winnie the Pooh.

I am Groot

Groot
"The romans used the name saturn to refer to one of their gods, we used it for something much more impressive." -Someone I can't remember, describing the Saturn V.

"Oooh, is that soft and queasy."

-Pete Conrad, commander of apollo 12, stepping from the LM's landing leg foot onto the moon, becoming the third human to walk on the moon.

(I'm not kidding, a journalist bet him 500 dollars to prove that what they say when they step onto the moon isn't scripted. I'm fairly certain he won that bet. )

On 12/11/2021 at 7:13 PM, Hyperspace Industries said:

"Oooh, is that soft and queasy."

-Pete Conrad, commander of apollo 12, stepping from the LM's landing leg foot onto the moon, becoming the third human to walk on the moon.

(I'm not kidding, a journalist bet him 500 dollars to prove that what they say when they step onto the moon isn't scripted. I'm fairly certain he won that bet. )

Now "One small step for man one giant leap for mankind" sound scripted so I understand the journalists. Probably more scripting today I think.

23 hours ago, magnemoe said:

Now "One small step for man one giant leap for mankind" sound scripted so I understand the journalists. Probably more scripting today I think.

I think the journalist was referring to whether they were all scripted or not. The first thing humans say on the surface of another world would be planned for the history books, the third, maybe not.

2 minutes ago, Hyperspace Industries said:

I think the journalist was referring to whether they were all scripted or not. The first thing humans say on the surface of another world would be planned for the history books, the third, maybe not.

Now that make more sense, and neither I or the journalist thought about that. Obviously the Apollo 11 landing was almost as scripted as an reality tv show. Some for effect, some for safety and some for return like one of the fist actions was to scope up some dust an put in an pocket on the space suit. Reason was that if they had to abort they got some surface sample. Later on they become more free and explore interesting stuff they found.
